bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, January 1, 1899

div1.p: Lawrence Reed writes, en route to Cuba, that he will land tomorrow.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, January 1, 1899

opener.dateline:
Havanah Cuba
on Board The
U.S.S. Chester
Jany. 1. 99.

div1.p:
Just a line to let
you know I am well & happy
although quite hungry. The
trip was very pleasant. as
far as the weather was concerned
but the accommodations were horrible.
We ran aground off the Keys of
Florida yesterday got here this morning but
cant understand why we will not
land until tomorrow, it is
hotter than the D, I am sitting
on deck in my undershirt and
am already “hot stuff” as soon
as I can tell you where we
are going I will write,
We left a little to soon, to see
the paymaster, do send me
a few stamps enough to last
me until we we get paid.
as I haven't a cent to my name
Well from an out side qu view
Havanah is a queer old place
Well I will close, now
write me soon and I will
do the same. with dearest
love to you all I am
div1.closer:
Your devoted Lawrence Excuse haste but I am
under orders.
